intro: Draba aizoidea, commonly known as the sand mat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Draba aizoidea is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited to survive in harsh, drought-prone conditions.
